# VegVault<img src="Outputs/Figures/website/VegVault_logo.png" align="right" width="250"/>

## Database linking global [paleo-]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}, and [neo-vegetation data]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}, [functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}, and [climate]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

This is the official website dedicated to the [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} project. [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} is a comprehensive [SQLite database]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} that integrates global [paleo-]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} and [neo-ecological vegetation data]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold} with [functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and [abiotic information]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}, including [climate]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and soil data. By bridging historical and contemporary data across multiple temporal and spatial scales, [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} provides a unique resource for examining long-term ecological patterns and processes, thereby enhancing our ability to predict future biodiversity trajectories and ecosystem responses under changing climatic conditions.

The project integrates data from multiple well-established sources including the [Neotoma Paleoecology Database](https://www.neotomadb.org/), [sPlotOpen](https://idiv-biodiversity.de/en/splot/splotopen.html), [BIEN](https://bien.nceas.ucsb.edu/bien/), [TRY Plant Trait Database](https://www.try-db.org/TryWeb/Home.php), [CHELSA climate data](https://chelsa-climate.org/), and [WoSIS soil data](https://www.isric.org/explore/wosis) to provide a comprehensive view of vegetation dynamics across space and time.

Creating such an [integrated database]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold}, in which gathering and processing of the data is [reproducible]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-white .text-bold}, is a crucial step toward improving our understanding of biodiversity dynamics under changing climatic conditions and safeguarding biodiversity in an uncertain future.

The project is part of the [BIODYNAMICS](https://bit.ly/BIODYNAMICS) project.
